title: View All Tabs in Chrome: Finding Open & Recently Closed Tabs

steps.title: Open Chrome.
steps.content: Open Chrome. Open the Chrome web browser on your computer. If you have multiple windows open, click on the one that you want to view all tabs for. Be sure that you’re using the most recent update of Chrome. You may not be able to view all tabs if you’re using an older version.

steps.title: Click on the Search Tabs icon.
steps.content: Click on the Search Tabs icon. This looks like a down arrow, and it’s in the upper-left corner of the Chrome window (directly to the left of the first open tab) on a PC and Chromebook, and at the top-right corner on a Mac. An alternative way to get here is by using the keyboard shortcut : Shift + Command + A on Mac, or Control + Shift + A on PC.

steps.title: Scroll through the tabs.
steps.content: Scroll through the tabs. Scroll through the Search Tabs popup window to view all your tabs. You can see all current tabs (underneath the “Open Tabs” header), as well as recently closed tabs (underneath the “ Recently Closed ” header). You won't see the number of tabs you have open. If you have lots of open tabs and want to know how many you have open, you'll need to install a Chrome extension like Chrome Tab Counter . Click any tab to display it.

steps.title: Search for a tab.
steps.content: Search for a tab. If you have many tabs open, you may prefer to search for a specific one. Do this by clicking the Search Tabs text box at the top of the popup window and typing in a keyword. Any tabs that fit your search criteria will appear below. [1] X Research source

steps.title: See grouped tabs (optional).
steps.content: See grouped tabs (optional). Tab groups are essentially folders for your tabs. If your group is closed, you won’t be able to see the tabs in it. To open it and see the tabs, simply click on the group label at the top of your window. Every tab inside will now appear to the right of the label. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Close an open tab.
steps.content: Close an open tab. To close out of a tab using the Search Tabs window, hover your cursor over a certain tab, then click the X to the right of it. If you close a tab by mistake and want to open it again , press Command + Shift + T on a Mac, or Ctrl + Shift + T on a PC or Chromebook.

steps.title: Open the Chrome app.
steps.content: Open the Chrome app. On your mobile phone, open up the Chrome application.

steps.title: Tap the Switch Tabs icon.
steps.content: Tap the Switch Tabs icon. If you're using an Android, you'll see this square with a number inside at the top of Chrome. On an iPhone or iPad, it's at the bottom of the screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll through your tabs.
steps.content: Scroll through your tabs. The Switch Tabs page displays all of your open tabs, so scroll through them to view them.

steps.title: Tap a tab to go to it.
steps.content: Tap a tab to go to it. If you want to navigate to a particular tab, simply tap on it within the Switch Tabs page.

steps.title: Close tabs (optional).
steps.content: Close tabs (optional). To close out of a tab within the Switch Tabs page, simply tap on the X button to the right of a particular tab. [4] X Research source
